FuncDef: To configure authentication, authorization, and accounting (AAA) authentication methods for console logins, use the aaa authentication login console command. To revert to the default, use the no form of this command.
CLIs: aaa authentication login console { group <group-list> } [ none ] | local | none }
no aaa authentication login console { group <group-list> [ none ] | local | none }

ParaDef.Info: Specifies to use a server group for authentication.

Space-separated list of RADIUS or TACACS+ server groups. The list can include the following: radius for all configured RADIUS servers. tacacs+ for all configured TACACS+ servers. Any configured RADIUS or TACACS+ server group name.
(Optional) Specifies to use the username for authentication.
(Optional) Specifies to use the local database for authentication.

Examples: switch(config)# aaa authentication login console group radius
switch(config)# no aaa authentication login console group radius
ExtraInfo:
The group radius, group tacacs+ , and group group-list methods refer to a set of previously defined RADIUS or TACACS+ servers. Use the radius-server host or tacacs-server host command to configure the host servers. Use the aaa group server command to create a named group of servers.If you specify the group method or local method and they fail, then the authentication can fail. If you specify the none method alone or after the group method, then the authentication always succeeds.
Command Default:The local database
msg: Error CLI:aaa authentication login console { group <group-list> } [ none ] | local | none }
